metadata.synopsis: The film traces the misadventures of buddies J.D. (Jack Black) and Wayne (Steve Zahn), who begin to suspect that their best friend, Darren Silverman (Jason Biggs), is going to allow himself to be badgered into marrying Judith (Amanda Peet), a woman he doesn't love. They decide to reunite him with his long lost love from their school days (Amanda Detmer) -- even if they have to kidnap Judith to do it.

reviews: ...a fairly worthless endeavor that squanders the efforts of an unusually talented cast.
Zahn always brings enthusiasm and energy to his roles, and this role is no exception.
A dumb comedy, but older teens may laugh.
The audience is one who needs saving, not the title character, in this latest entry in the look-how-dumb-I-can-get comedy sweepstakes.

Peppered with naked senior citizens, trash-talking nuns and a bloody plastic surgery operation, "Silverman" will be best enjoyed by people who truly believe "gross" and "silly" are synonyms for "funny"...
Mulher Infernal no  apenas uma comdia mal realizada e sem a menor graa. , tambm, uma produo capaz de insultar a inteligncia do espectador a todo momento.
Silverman is the newest "comedy" from director Dennis Dugan who has made such other "hits" as Big Daddy, Beverly Hills Ninja, and Happy Gilmore.
We all have our guilty pleasures.
Es una pena que ya no existan cmicos que recurran al verdadero ingenio para lograr lo que cada vez es ms difcil, que es hacer rer al pblico
A sexy Amanda Peet takes down the dimwitted duo of Steve Zahn and Jack Black in a comedy where everyone but the title character is entertaining.
Such promise, such disappointment - such a great cast - how could this movie have come out so badly?
I am embarrassed for having laughed at it, but not too embarrassed to suggest that you might laugh as well.
